Share: Digg Facebook StumbleUpon SARS Cases Continue to Increase © 2003 by Linda Moulton Howe SARS Cases as of April 7- 8, 2003 Reported by CDC and W.H.O. United States Suspected SARS pneumonia cases in the United States have climbed to 148 in 30 states; no deaths. Alabama 1 California 38 Colorado 5 Connecticut 2 Florida 5 Georgia 2 Hawaii 5 Illinois 7 Kansas 1 Maine 2 Massachusetts 4 Michigan 2 Missouri 2 Mississippi 1 Minnesota 5 New Hampshire 1 New Jersey 3 New Mexico 1 North Carolina 5 New York 21 Ohio 5 Oregon 1 Pennsylvania 5 Rhode Island 1 Te x a s 4 Utah 5 Vermont 2 Virginia 2 Washington 9 Wisconsin 1 Total Suspected U. S. Cases Under Investigation: 148 in 30 states. No deaths. Wo r l d w i d e : Australia 1 case Brazil 1 Canada 91 cases, 10 deaths China 1279 cases, 53 deaths

China, Hong Kong 928 cases, 25 deaths China, Taiwan, 19 France, 4 Germany 5 Italy 3 Malaysia 1 case, 1 death Ireland 1 Romania 1 Singapore 113 cases, 8 deaths Spain 1 Switzerland, 1 Thailand 7 cases, 2 deaths United Kingdom 5 United States 148 Viet Nam 62 cases, 4 deaths April 7 - Current World Total: 2601 Cases and 98 Deaths April 8 - World Total Jumped to 2,671 Cases and 103 Deaths with majority of new cases coming from Guandong Province and Hong Kong, China.
